resources.string: To start the Yincana you need to activate the localization permission.

Few lands preserve such an abundance of vestiges of the Prehistory as those of Pontevedra. Here, there are remnants from the Neolithic or the Megalithic until the "castros" times and the beginnings of the Roman occupation. The cultural and patrimonial offer of this space must be written with capital letters when we talk about Rock Art.

There are many petroglyphs that can be found in the hills of Campo Lameiro, Cerdedo-Cotobade, Marín, Poio, Ponte Caldelas, Pontevedra, Vilaboa, A Lama and Barro; In addition to the megalithic tombs and castros that rise in all this territory.

The presence of these remains helped the transmission of a rich folk tradition associated with the traces of the past that gave rise to a series of myths and legends that reach our days, as the legend that assures that Teucro (one of the heroes of the Trojan War) is the founder of Pontevedra.
The Rock Art is a phenomenon that spans several millennia of duration, the main group of Galician engravings was generated during the III and II a.C millennia, and in the Bronze Age.

The petroglyphs are engraved on the stone in the open air. In some, nature is represented with horses, snakes, deer and also hunting scenes. In others there are geometric representations such as labyrinths, spirals and bowls.Do you want to know the best works of Terras de Pontevedra? Come with me.
Hello! My name is Petra. I\'m an artist of the bronze age.
I love making petroglyphs in stone.
I live between Verdugo and Lérez rivers, in a paradise called TERRAS DE PONTEVEDRA
I\'m fine, thanks. Do you have any suggestion for walking among petroglyphs?
Oh! Yes, I do. I can tell you a few things:
Do not touch or step over the engravings, as that helps to accelerate its erosion. That means that traces of our history could be lost.
Even if you do not appreciate well the petroglyphs, do not re-mark them. Paints or inks helps the destruction of the designs.
What can I do to avoid it?
During the visit, use the trails and platforms enabled.
Take with you the trash and other objects that can damage the environment. Put them in the right places.
When is the best time to see the petroglyphs?
The visit will be more rewarding at sunrise or sunset. At this time it is easier to see the furrows on the rocky surfaces.
Does all the petroglyphs have an easily access?
Although some routes have trails and platforms, most of the petroglyphs are located in mountain areas. So I recommend you to pay your visit with comfortable clothes and closed footwear.
You can find an exciting adventure in the menu. Are you ready?
You can download all the content to use this app without internet.
Make sure you are connected to a WiFi network. Downloading maps can take several minutes.
Here you can filter by itinerary.

Immerse yourself in the adventure and unlock all the achievements
Start your adventure and find all the petroglyphs
Do you want to check how much do you know about petroglyphs?
Hold the button if you are next to some petroglyph.
There was an error, activate the permissions
That\'s what we propose in this Yincana, collect petroglyphs. For it you must visit them, know them and keep them in your bag.
Very easy, every time you visit a petroglyph or complete a Quiz you will discover a card. The more you discover, the more powers you will have. You can be the wise man of the tribe.
Start with the Quizzes (small exams on Rock Art), it will be like your primary education. Continue visiting Petroglyphs, when the phone detects that you have visited one will open a card.
Do not forget to visit the Interpretation Centers and most importantly: enjoy the rock art, one of the great vestiges of our past.
